items.question: Can I change the date/time of my appointment?
answer: Yes, you can change the date or time of the appointment at least 1 hour before the appointment. Please call 6472 2000 or email AH_appointment@nuhs.edu.sg to rearrange your appointment. Alternatively, you may also rearrange your appointment via the OneNUHS app.

items.question: I need to travel overseas on the day of my appointment. What can I do?
answer: Please call 6472 2000 to rearrange your appointment, or arrange to have it via phone/video call.

items.question: I have missed my appointment. What do I do now?
answer: Please do not panic. Call 6472 2000 and our friendly staff we will help you to arrange another timeslot for your appointment. If you already here, please check with the counter if you can still have the appointment today.

items.question: My condition relapsed but my next appointment is still far away. Where can I get help?
answer: For serious relapses, please visit the nearest clinic and seek help immediately. Otherwise, you may call 6472 2000 to bring forward your appointment, or visit your neighborhood polyclinic to get help.

items.question: I have run out of medication. How can I get more?
answer: You may order via one of the four ways:
1) Order and collect it in person at Central Pharmacy at Alexandra Hospital.
2) Complete and email the Medication Delivery Form to ah_homedelivery@nuhs.edu.sg.
3) Call 6379 3331 to make the order.
4) Order via the OneNUHS app.
Download the medication delivery form here: https://www.ah.com.sg/Documents/Pharmacy/AH-Med_Delivery-Flyer.pdf

items.question: I am experiencing discomfort after consuming new medication. Where can I get help?
answer: Please stop consuming the medication immediately and call our hotline 6472 2000.

items.question: I forgot to consume my medication yesterday. What do I do now?
answer: Do not panic. Please ignore it and stick to the original schedule. Overdosing can be very dangerous.

items.question: I would like to get a digital copy of my medical report.
answer: Please contact your doctor to request for your medical report. Alternatively, you may obtain it through the OneNUHS app.

items.question: When will I get the result for my checkup?
answer: The doctor will only call you if there is any bad news. Otherwise, you may obtain the report on HealthHub.

items.question: Does Alexandra Hospital provide any financial aid?
answer: Alexandra Hospital and the Singapore government provides financial aid for patients who require it. Please call 6472 2000 to find out what financial assistance schemes you are elligible for, or any other financial assistance enquiries.

items.question: I would like to get a hearing aid. Are there any subsidies provided?
answer: Please call 6472 2000 to enquire about the financial assistance that we provide.

items.question: Do I have to take the COVID-19 vaccine? What are the side effects?
answer: You are highly recommended to take the COVID-19 vaccine if you are elligible for it. The vaccines have been assessed too be safe for use.
However, you may experience some side effects, including:
1) Pain, redness or swelling at the injection side.
2) Fever and chills.
3) Headache, muscle pain or joint paint.
4) Tiredness.
5) Lymph node swelling at neck or arms.
These side effects are temporary and may be a sign that your immune system is making a protection response against COVID-19.
